title: Super Mario Bros. Scene Annotations
description: This TSV file contains one row per Super Mario Bros. scene. Columns include scene identifiers, entry/exit positions, and design-pattern annotations based on Dahlskog & Togelius (2012) plus additional custom patterns.

columns.name: World
columns.description: The world ID (1–8).

columns.name: Level
columns.description: The level ID within a given world (1–3).

columns.name: Scene
columns.description: The scene ID (unique within World–Level).

columns.name: x Hi (entry)
columns.description: (Optional) High byte or partial coordinate for the entry X position.

columns.name: x Lo (entry)
columns.description: (Optional) Low byte or partial coordinate for the entry X position.

columns.name: x Hi (exit)
columns.description: (Optional) High byte or partial coordinate for the exit X position.

columns.name: x Lo (exit)
columns.description: (Optional) Low byte or partial coordinate for the exit X position.

columns.name: Entry point
columns.description: Full X position marking the beginning of the scene.

columns.name: Exit point
columns.description: Full X position marking the end of the scene.

columns.name: Layout
columns.description: A placeholder or descriptive label of the layout; unused in many rows.

columns.name: Enemy
columns.description: Indicates presence (1) or absence (0) of a single enemy.

columns.name: 2-Horde
columns.description: Two enemies together.

columns.name: 3-Horde
columns.description: Three enemies together.

columns.name: 4-Horde
columns.description: Four enemies together.

columns.name: Roof
columns.description: Enemies are placed underneath a hanging platform (Mario can hit the ceiling).

columns.name: Gap
columns.description: Single gap in the ground/platform.

columns.name: Multiple gaps
columns.description: More than one gap with fixed platforms in between.

columns.name: Variable gaps
columns.description: Gaps and platform widths vary.

columns.name: Gap enemy
columns.description: Enemies in the air above gaps.

columns.name: Pillar gap
columns.description: Pillar objects (e.g., pipes/blocks) placed on platforms between gaps.

columns.name: Valley
columns.description: A valley created by vertically stacked blocks/pipes (no Piranha plants).

columns.name: Pipe valley
columns.description: A valley with pipes and Piranha plants.

columns.name: Empty valley
columns.description: A valley without enemies.

columns.name: Enemy valley
columns.description: A valley that contains enemies.

columns.name: Roof valley
columns.description: A valley with enemies and a roof (Mario can bounce on the ceiling).

columns.name: 2-Path
columns.description: A hanging platform allowing Mario to choose between two paths.

columns.name: 3-Path
columns.description: Two hanging platforms allowing Mario to choose between three paths.

columns.name: Risk/Reward
columns.description: A multiple-path situation where one path has a reward but is riskier (enemy or gap).

columns.name: Stair up
columns.description: A stair going upwards.

columns.name: Stair down
columns.description: A stair going downwards.

columns.name: Empty stair valley
columns.description: A valley between a stair up and stair down without enemies.

columns.name: Enemy stair valley
columns.description: A valley between a stair up and stair down with enemies.

columns.name: Gap stair valley
columns.description: A valley between a stair up and stair down that has a gap.

columns.name: Reward
columns.description: Rewards without immediate danger.

columns.name: Moving platform
columns.description: A platform moving vertically or horizontally.

columns.name: Flagpole
columns.description: The ending flagpole of a level.

columns.name: Beginning
columns.description: Indicates the beginning of the level.

columns.name: Bonus zone
columns.description: A hidden zone without enemies.

columns.name: Waterworld
columns.description: A special hidden zone with underwater gameplay.
